data.title: Pranjal Chalise - Peer Career Advisor at Amherst College | The Org
data.snippet:
# Pranjal Chalise

### Peer Career Advisor

Pranjal Chalise is a Software Engineer at Microsoft since June 2025, specializing in CoreAI. Concurrently, Pranjal serves as a Peer Career Advisor and a Peer Tutor in both the Math and Computer Science Departments at Amherst College, providing support for students in academic and professional development. Pranjal's prior experience includes working as an AI/ML Fellow and Software Engineer at Microsoft in 2024, and holding various roles at Amherst College such as Math & Stats Student Steering Committee Fellow and IT Specialist. Additionally, Pranjal contributed as a Research Assistant and Research Scholar at Incubate Nepal and is pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science and Mathematics at Amherst College, expected to graduate in May 2026. [...] Log inSign up

data.title: Pranjal Chalise: An Enthusiastic Technopreneur! - Glocal Teen Hero
data.snippet:
Pranjal has aided the Blind Community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps the blind community in currency bills recognition and cash transactions. By creating Kisan Nepal, a mobile application that offers agricultural news and information from reliable sources and keeps farmers informed and alert, he has helped to alleviate agricultural and farmer limitations. 

Currently, He is working as an incubator and app developer at Incubate Nepal. He is recognized as one of the brightest high school students (One of 20 selected students from all disciplines and one of 10 for Computer Science) from all over Nepal to work on open-end research projects under the mentorship of MIT and Harvard graduates. [...] Currently, He is also working in a research paper on the topic ‚ÄúBlockchain Technology, Smart Contracts and its application in Nepal‚Äôs securities.‚Äù Apart from this; he has been effectively learning Data Science and Machine Learning from platforms like Coursera and edX for three years now. 

He is a member of the board of the Initiative in Nepal Foundation (INF) which has an international platform and audience. He is working as the President of Computer Science Initiatives in Nepal. The Foundation has partnerships with many recognized universities and their faculty, schools, and collaboration partners to promote the field of Physics, Mathematics, and Computer Science through sessions, workshops and different competitions related to STEM. [...] Apart from that; He is the founder & Project Mentor of Students Research Council Nepal (SRCN), (an organization that provides the platform of research and project-based education to high-school enthusiasts and provides paper-writing and app development training). He finished the initial round of research and launched Gyan-E, Nepal‚Äôs first-ever discussion forum. They have guided 7 brilliant high schoolers under his mentorship. In the International Journal, SRCN has successfully published 4 research papers.

As a Computer Science Mentor, he taught coding and mobile app development to high school students. His work has been recognized by the Nepal Academy of Science and Technology for their efforts to introduce the concept of research and instill it in young students.

data.title: Team Tumornators | An Incubate Nepal Project
data.snippet:
2021

## Aayusha Dhungana

Team Samsad(2021)

‚ÄúPolitics and Social science, something that I was not really fond of. But to my own surprise, I was paired up with my team mates to build a website featuring parliament system of Nepal. Entering the whole new world of website building and politics surely frightened me, but the continuous support from the mentor and my wonderful team made this whole journey very smooth and informative. Incubate Nepal, helped me break my comforting cocoon and stand out in the crowd to learn, take challenges and share tons of memories with the whole team.‚Äù

2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020) [...] 2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020)

‚ÄúA surreal utopia where friends turned into F.R.I.E.N.D.S, and fanatics into professionals. Contributing to two different teams- ‚ÄòTeam Kisan' and ‚ÄòTeam Drishti' was overwhelming but the realization that, through my projects, I could deliver ripple effects in the community- be it in the lives of farmers or differently-abled people, was certainly more promising. A bunch of high-school pass-outs coming together to create impacts on society sounds a bit fancy. At Incubate Nepal you'll witness countless such fancy sugarcoats turning into real-life realities.‚Äù

2020

## Anupa Khanal

Team Brahmanda(2020) [...] 2020

## Shruti Pokhrel

Team Kisan(2020)

‚ÄúIncubate Nepal was truly an overwhelming experience that paved the way for me to make connections with people whilst developing teamwork and analytical skills. Exposure to open-ended projects under the guidance of some of the highly accomplished mentors to channel our creative stream and collaborate in prototyping an application ‚ÄòKISAN' - perhaps the best aspect of the project. It was through this opportunity that I was able to peek into the world beyond and believe in the possibility of the tremendous potential there is for me to learn and work in the near future.‚Äù

2020

data.title: Student Staff - Loeb Center for Career Exploration and Planning
data.snippet:
I am a member of the Amherst Women‚Äôs Cross Country and Track and Field team. When I am not running, you can often find me in the music building or the science center, as I am a member of the Glee Club and Concert Choir while co-leading the Mammoth MakerLab Club. For the past two years, I have been a member of the Education Professions group and enjoy having meaningful discussions and workshops with my peers. In my free time, I also love hiking, biking, reading, and spending time with my family and friends. [...] At Amherst, I‚Äôm involved in research with the Chemistry department on energy transfer using quantum dots for different applications. Since freshman year, I‚Äôve been involved in research with the Spanish/LLAS department on community filmmaking in Latin America. On campus I‚Äôm a member of La Causa, La Fe, and Questbridge. Last semester, I attended the American Educational Research Association‚Äôs international conference in Philadelphia. This summer I had the pleasure of doing a research internship at UPenn in the Mechanical/Chemical Engineering department.

In my free time, I enjoy spending time in nature, baking, watching Netflix, and getting boba with friends. [...] Aside from working at the Loeb Center, I also love rowing with the crew team, doing mock trial, or going to the occasional wrestling practice with the UMass club wrestling team. I also love to knit, and you‚Äôll often find me working on a sweater or hat in between classes.

## Maggie Su

Employer Engagement Intern

Hi, I‚Äôm Maggie Su, class of 2028. I‚Äôm double-majoring in Mathematics and Economics, while also constantly exploring the variety of courses Amherst offers. On campus, I‚Äôm involved in Women in Finance, Poker Club, Bridge Club, and Archery. Outside of classes and clubs, you can find me at poker games, drumming (which I started last year!), training for my private pilot‚Äôs license, and grinding online bridge tournaments.
